attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 08.04.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (-13.5 loaves)

Ø  Polybags-  (+274 pieces)

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        Proper controls should be maintained
attributes.effect: Minimal variances noted is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: We will maintain.
There is an improvement from the previous findings and we will continue improving.
A cumulative shortfall of 517 loaves and polybags variance of +567 pieces was reported in the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        All sample varieties had minimal cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 01%, 400g W- 05% and 800g W- 0%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are being observed.

value: We will continue making improvements.
More control measures will be initiated.
Cases of underweight reported in the previous audit were as follows; 400g W- 13%, 200g W-16% and 800g W-09%.
Previous

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.03.25 – 07.04.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.
attributes.effect: Production standards were observed.

value: ·        We will maintain
To be maintained.
No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Damages analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Analysis of bread damages from 21.02.25 – 16.03.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,665.5 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.24% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,799 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.19% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        No significant variance from the set limits was noted

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        The effective controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
To be maintained.
Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit as per the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY

·        The branch hired a total of 601 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,705 bags.

·        The actual production was 2,773 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 4.61 bags per worker.

·        The set efficiency was achieved

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: Management to maintain the proper planning of workers to ensure that the set efficiencies are consistently achieved
attributes.effect: No significant variation from the set target efficiency was noted indicating that labour cost incurred was within the forecasted range.

value: We will maintain
Proper planning will be maintained.
Production efficiency was within the range.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
PACKAGING EFFICIENCY

·        The total converted bread produced over the audited period is 51,558 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 532 workers.

·        A total of 530 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 97.3 crates per worker which is within the range.

Packaging efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to maintain the proper planning of workers to ensure that the set efficiencies are consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: No significant variation from the set target efficiencies was noted indicating that labour cost incurred was within the forecasted range.

value: We will maintain.
Proper planning will be maintained.
Packaging efficiency reported in the previous audit report was 84.4 crates per worker. Production efficiency was within the range.
Previous

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: We will maintain
We will maintain
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Minishop spot-checks
attributes.description:
Finding;

·        Spot checks was done on the branch minishops to find out if they were run as per the company policy.

·        On the spot-check days, no issue of non-compliance was noted in the visited minishops.
attributes.recommendation: Minishops SOPs to continue being observed.
attributes.effect: Minishop SOPs are being observed.

value: To be maintained
The positive trend will be maintained.
SOPs were observed in the previous audit findings.
